item.title: Uber has found a clever way to bypass a roadblock in Argentina involving bitcoin
item.description:
Uber has found a clever way to bypass a roadblock in Argentina involving bitcoin

Uber is facing strong opposition in Buenos Aires, where the company has been operating since mid-April without a permit or tax-identification number. The massively funded startup is being sued by taxi unions. City officials have issued multiple injunctions attempting to bring its service to a halt.

item.title: Coinbase Suspends Canadian Dollar Services Amid $10.5M Raise From Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi UFJ
item.description:
Coinbase Suspends Canadian Dollar Services Amid $10.5M Raise From Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi UFJ

San Francisco-based Coinbase, a leading Bitcoin exchange offering numerous services and products, has informed its Canadian users they must liquidate their CAD holdings by July 29th. "As of August 1, Coinbase's Canadian payments provider, Vogogo, will be shutting down its payment processing business," Coinbase stated in an email to users seen by Bitcoin Magazine.

item.title: Are you addicted to Bitcoin? It's ok you can admit it. * /r/Bitcoin
item.description:
Are you addicted to Bitcoin? It's ok you can admit it. * /r/Bitcoin

Are you addicted to Bitcoin? I will admit I am. Every day I am reading more about Bitcoin and watching videos on YouTube as well as talking about...

item.title: A startup is trying solve bitcoin's child pornography problem
item.description:
A startup is trying solve bitcoin's child pornography problem

Bitcoin, a currency with the promise of anonymity and no government regulation, is a potential hotbed for nefarious activities. On Wednesday (July 6), London-based bitcoin startup Elliptic announced that it was teaming up with International Watch Foundation (IWF), a non-profit in the UK that monitors online child abuse, to curb the cryptocurrency's role in the spread of child...

item.title: Coinbase Raises Investment, Eyes the Japanese Market - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Coinbase Raises Investment, Eyes the Japanese Market - NEWSBTC

Coinbase has announced its strategic partnership with a Japanese financial institution and its intentions to enter the Japanese market. Read more... Coinbase, the leading cryptocurrency company has today announced its partnership with a leading Japanese financial institution, Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group Inc. (NYSE : MTU).

item.title: Bitcoin Scam Site Warning - BTCPanda
item.description:
Bitcoin Scam Site Warning - BTCPanda

In the wake of Hashocean shutting down, Bitcoin users are looking for new ways to increase their holdings. Unfortunately for then, the number of Ponzi schemes continue to increase at an accelerated pace. BTCPanda is one of the most recent platforms to launch, offering users up to 12% return every day, depending on how much they invested.

item.title: Why bitcoin's price could be poised to shoot higher
item.description:
Why bitcoin's price could be poised to shoot higher

By Currency traders are seemingly obsessed with trying to predict the Federal Reserve's next move, meticulously analyzing every word of every official communique for clues about the future path of monetary policy. There's nothing like that in the world of bitcoin. Instead, the rate at which the bitcoin supply increases is preordained by a few lines of code.

item.title: Bitcoin Remittance Startup Freemit to Close Amid Funding Shortfall - CoinDesk
item.description:
Bitcoin Remittance Startup Freemit to Close Amid Funding Shortfall - CoinDesk

Bitcoin remittance startup Freemit is officially closing its doors, two years after it first began an effort to build a remittance service. CEO John Biggs, a former editor for TechCrunch, said that the decision to shutter the operation came after a "perfect storm" of a lack of a viable product to show investors and, consequently, the inability to raise funds.

item.title: New EU Cybersecurity Laws to Cover Online Banking, Markets
item.description:
New EU Cybersecurity Laws to Cover Online Banking, Markets

The European Union (EU) parliament has approved a new set of cybersecurity laws, ordering firms in "essential service" industries like banking, health, energy and transport to bolster their defenses against cyber-attacks. Also read: Industry Report: How China, France, and the FBI Do Bitcoin The EU network and information security (NIS) directive represents the first EU-wide standards on cybersecurity.
